text.summary: Having a legally obtained monopoly is not a crime, but abusing it to gain unfair advantages in other markets can be. During the waning days of the Bush administration, Varney worried that the government would not do enough about Google: "I think we're going to continually see a problem, potentially, with Google, who I think so far has acquired a monopoly in Internet online advertising lawfully." Now she's in a position to do something about it. Chris AndersonSpecial to CNNWhen Christine Varney was confirmed in May as the Obama administration's top antitrust cop, some of her words from last year sent a chill through the Googleplex, the search engine's headquarters in Silicon Valley. Keep reading...
